question.title: Will Alex Jones face new bankruptcy proceedings by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, new bankruptcy proceedings are initiated against Alex Jones, as confirmed by official court records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The proceedings must be separate from and unrelated to any previous bankruptcy cases. If no such new proceedings are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, 'new bankruptcy proceedings' refer to any formal legal action filed in a bankruptcy court that names Alex Jones as the debtor, whether it's a voluntary filing by Jones himself or an involuntary petition filed by creditors.

question.title: Will Boehringer Ingelheim allow generic production of its COPD medication by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Boehringer Ingelheim officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its COPD medication, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Boehringer Ingelheim continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will Italy and Australia implement a new form of cooperation by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Italy and Australia have publicly announced the implementation of a new form of cooperation as part of a bilateral action plan. A 'new form of cooperation' refers to a collaborative initiative or agreement that is distinctly different from their existing partnerships as of October 1, 2023. question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Arizona state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

not_P.body:

3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. A such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

The inquiry will be marked as NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the results of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the given timeframe.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Denver by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Denver, Colorado. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Denver rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Taiwan Weighted Index reach or exceed 20,000 points by August 2024?

question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

not_P.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule not complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule does not successfully complete a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must not involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must not land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must not be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must not be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- A mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted and meets all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used for a crewed return mission from the ISS to Earth.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

para_P.title: Will NASA's Orion spacecraft achieve a manned return journey from the ISS before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion spacecraft successfully carries out a manned return journey from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For an affirmative outcome:

1. The operation must include the Orion spacecraft transporting a minimum of one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The spacecraft must land safely, ensuring all crew members are unharmed.
3. The success of the mission must be officially acknowledged by NASA or another recognized space agency.
4. This acknowledgment must be reported by at least two major, credible news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The inquiry will be resolved as negative if:
- No such operation takes place by the given date.
- An attempt is made, but it fails to satisfy all the aforementioned criteria.
- The Orion spacecraft is utilized solely for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return trip.

Note: This inquiry does not account for test flights or simulations. Only genuine manned return missions from the ISS are considered for resolution.

question.title: Will the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Gates Foundation channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or not reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India publicly declares a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual RBI members will not be considered for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude as negative.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the FDA's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Slack confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Slack confirms a number of layoffs that is at least 1,800, or if such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is it true that Slack will terminate a minimum of 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Slack has officially announced the termination of at least 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Confirmation must be derived from official company statements, regulatory documents, or reports from no fewer than two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-centric reorganization plan revealed in 2023. If Slack verifies a lesser number of terminations, or if no confirmation that meets these standards is provided by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. question.title: Will Elim Chan be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Elim Chan is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. The recognition must be based on her age at the time of her appointment to a major orchestra, such as the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. The recognition must explicitly state that she is the youngest person to hold such a position. If no such recognition occurs by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in such a role, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Cruise's robotaxis be available on Uber's ride-hailing service in South America by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Cruise's autonomous vehicles (robotaxis) are confirmed to be operational and available for passenger rides through Uber's ride-hailing service in at least one South American city. Confirmation must come from official statements by either Cruise or Uber, or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch). The service must be publicly accessible to regular Uber users, not just for testing or limited trials. If no such availability is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the partnership is canceled or indefinitely delayed, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current mpox outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern in July 2022. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will South Dakota hold a referendum on environmental policies by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, South Dakota officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of environmental policies. The referendum must be related to implementing significant changes in the state's environmental regulations or policies. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the South Dakota state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will over 23,000 minority farmers receive USDA discrimination payments?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, more than 23,000 minority farmers have been confirmed to receive payments from the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) as part of a federal aid program addressing past discrimination. The number of recipients must be verified by official USDA documentation or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The payments must be specifically related to addressing historical discrimination against minority farmers. If the number of confirmed recipients is 23,000 or fewer by the resolution date, or if the information cannot be reliably verified, the question resolves as NO.

The payments must not be specifically related to addressing historical discrimination against minority farmers. If the number of confirmed recipients is more than 23,000 by the resolution date, or if the information can be reliably verified, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that over 23,000 minority farmers have received payments from the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) as part of a federal assistance initiative aimed at rectifying past discrimination. question.title: Will Sudan report over 50 cholera-related deaths by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, official reports confirm that the cholera outbreak in Sudan has resulted in more than 50 deaths. Confirmation must come from at least one of the following sources: Sudanese health authorities, the World Health Organization (WHO), or reputable international news agencies (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC) citing official figures. The death toll must be specifically attributed to the cholera outbreak that began in 2023. If the number of confirmed cholera-related deaths in Sudan remains at 50 or fewer by the resolution date, or if no reliable data is available, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Hulu and Peacock announce a merger agreement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Hulu and Peacock publicly announce a merger agreement. The merger agreement should involve the combination of the two companies' operations or assets in some form. This question does not require the merger to be completed by the resolution date, only that an agreement is announced. If no such announcement is made by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mandatory wellness program by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mandatory wellness program for beneficiaries. The wellness program must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Darden Restaurants announce plans to acquire The Cheesecake Factory by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Darden Restaurants (the parent company of Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse, and other restaurant chains) officially announces plans to acquire The Cheesecake Factory. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements, regulatory filings (such as SEC filings), or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal). The announcement of intent to acquire is sufficient for a YES resolution; the acquisition does not need to be completed by this date. If no such announcement is made by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Darden Restaurants not announce plans to acquire The Cheesecake Factory by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Darden Restaurants (the parent company of Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse, and other restaurant chains) does not officially announce plans to acquire The Cheesecake Factory. The lack of an announcement must be confirmed through the absence of official company statements, regulatory filings (such as SEC filings), or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal). The lack of an announcement of intent to acquire is sufficient for a YES resolution; the acquisition does not need to be completed by this date. If such an announcement is made by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, Darden Restaurants (the parent organization of Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse, and other dining establishments) publicly discloses plans to purchase The Cheesecake Factory. The confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory documents (such as SEC filings), or reports from at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal). question.title: Will Belarus withdraw its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Belarus publicly announces the withdrawal of its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the Belarusian government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The withdrawal must be a clear and unambiguous retraction of Belarus's application to join the organization, not merely a postponement or reconsideration. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if Belarus joins the organization before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Belarus not withdraw its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Belarus does not publicly announce the withdrawal of its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization. The lack of announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the Belarusian government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The absence of withdrawal must be a clear and unambiguous indication that Belarus has not retracted its application to join the organization, not merely a postponement or reconsideration. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if Belarus does not join the organization before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is Belarus going to retract its request to become a member of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Belarus makes a public declaration to retract its request to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization. The declaration must be validated by official communications from the Belarusian authorities and covered by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The retraction must be a definitive and clear withdrawal of Belarus's request to join the organization, rather than just a delay or reassessment. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if Belarus becomes a member of the organization prior to that date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to historically Black business schools by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of historically Black business schools. The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these business schools. question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Texas state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.

The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if IBM only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

not_P.title: Will IBM not announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM does not publicly announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The absence of the announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The lack of an increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If such an announcement is made by the specified date, or if IBM announces maintaining or increasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the absence of the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

para_P.title: Will IBM reveal intentions to expand its AI workforce by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, IBM publicly reveals intentions to expand its AI workforce. The revelation must occur through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or verified social media accounts) or be covered by at least two significant news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The intention to expand the AI workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely inferred from broader hiring strategies. If no such revelation is made by the deadline, or if IBM only states plans to maintain or reduce its AI workforce, the inquiry will be considered negative. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of intentions, rather than the actual execution of those intentions.

question.title: Will Harvest Moon Produce be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Harvest Moon Produce is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Harvest Moon Produce and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Harvest Moon Produce by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Moscow announce a public transit-only policy for its 2026 World Cup venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Moscow or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to World Cup venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Moscow not announce a public transit-only policy for its 2026 World Cup venues by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Moscow or an official representative of the city government does not announce a policy stating that all venues for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must not be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should not explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to World Cup venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a declaration from Moscow regarding a public transport-exclusive policy for its venues of the 2026 World Cup by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Moscow or a designated representative of the city government makes a declaration that all locations for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will only be reachable via public transportation. The declaration must occur through official means (such as a press conference, formal statement, or city government website) or be covered by at least two major news organizations. The policy should clearly indicate the aim to limit access for private vehicles to World Cup locations, encouraging the utilization of public transport instead. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the declared policy permits any notable exceptions to the public transport-only mandate, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will a major AI research lab's chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major AI research lab's chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI research lab's chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Valley Fresh Produce and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Valley Fresh Produce by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Mexico become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Mexico is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on marijuana legalization. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address marijuana legalization, either proposing to legalize or to restrict its use. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on marijuana does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Microsoft's AI chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Africa's National Council of Provinces passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Cyril Ramaphosa or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.body:

1. The bill must not be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must not be passed by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If such a bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, including fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be approved by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it is enacted into law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly documented by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential effect on the South African economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a piece of legislation is approved but fails to satisfy all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will resolve as negative.

question.title: Will the Utah Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Utah Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Utah legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Utah legislative records. If such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

question.title: Will Oscar Mayer issue a recall of hot dogs due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oscar Mayer officially announces a recall of any of its hot dog products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Oscar Mayer's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Oscar Mayer
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning an Oscar Mayer recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

The conclusion must be verified through an official announcement from the FCA or reported by a minimum of two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FCA fails to declare the conclusion of such an inquiry by this deadline, or if the inquiry remains active, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. question.title: Will Maple Leaf Foods issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maple Leaf Foods officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Maple Leaf Foods' website or social media channels
2. A press release from Maple Leaf Foods
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Maple Leaf Foods recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Marta Rovira return to Spain and face a trial related to the 2017 Catalan independence referendum by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Marta Rovira returns to Spain and is officially put on trial for her involvement in organizing the 2017 Catalan independence referendum. The trial must be formally initiated in a Spanish court, with Rovira physically present or represented by legal counsel. For the purpose of this question, 'trial' refers to the commencement of legal proceedings in a court of law, not merely an indictment or charges being filed. The charges must be directly related to Rovira's role in the 2017 referendum, which was declared illegal by Spanish authorities. If no such trial begins by the specified date, or if Rovira is granted immunity or amnesty that prevents a trial from occurring, the question will resolve as NO. The resolution of this question is not dependent on the outcome of any potential trial.

question.title: Will Massachusetts hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Massachusetts officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Massachusetts state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will large protests occur in Israel in response to military draft notices for ultra-Orthodox men by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Israel specifically in response to the Israeli military's decision to send draft notices to ultra-Orthodox men. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Israel. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of military draft notices for ultra-Orthodox men. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the draft notice policy is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Russia report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially reports a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia not report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia does not officially report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating that the yields are not higher than average compared to the previous five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Russia makes an official declaration of a substantial harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, reflecting yields that are notably above the average of the past five years. question.title: Will New Zealand appoint a new Prime Minister by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a new Prime Minister is officially appointed in New Zealand. For the purpose of this question, a 'new' Prime Minister refers to an individual who is not currently serving in this role as of October 1, 2023. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank Indonesia communications, such as press releases, Board of Governors statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date.
